meanings.sent1: After many years away, the family decided to start reinhabiting their old house.
meanings.sent2: The birds are reinhabiting the trees after the winter season.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels are reinhabiting the attic, making it their cozy home.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, the town starts reinhabiting with the sounds of laughter and music.
meanings.sent5: The flowers reinhabiting the garden brought back memories of spring.

meanings.sent1: The explorers were excited to begin reinhabiting the ancient ruins they discovered.
meanings.sent2: The students decided to reinhabit the library during exam week.
meanings.sent3: The cats are reinhabiting the sunny spot by the window, claiming it as their own.
meanings.sent4: The old bookstore reinhabited by new owners now buzzes with life and activity.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh bread reinhabiting the kitchen made everyone hungry.

meanings.definition: To return to (a place) and live there.
meanings.sent1: After traveling the world, she felt the pull to reinhabit her childhood home.
meanings.sent2: The nomadic tribe decided to reinhabit their traditional lands.
meanings.sent3: The cozy cabin by the lake was reinhabited by a family of ducks.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were reinhabited by a community seeking peace and solitude.
meanings.sent5: The old lighthouse reinhabited by a keeper brought light back to the dark coast.
